sentences.en: Dornberg slapped the table with the palm of his hand.
sentences.cn: 多恩伯格用手拍着桌子。

sentences.en: He could feel the beads digging into his palm.
sentences.cn: 他能感觉到珠子硌得手心生疼。

sentences.en: He cupped her chin in the palm of his hand.
sentences.cn: 他用手心托着她的下巴。

sentences.en: He emptied the contents out into the palm of his hand.
sentences.cn: 他把东西都倒在手心里。

sentences.en: He held the bird gently in the palm of his hand .
sentences.cn: 他把小鸟轻轻地托在掌心。

sentences.en: He held the pebble in the palm of his hand .
sentences.cn: 他把那颗卵石握在手心里。

sentences.en: In the end, I turned down Raoul's tempting offer of the Palm Beach trip.
sentences.cn: 最终，我回绝了拉乌尔提出的去棕榈海滩旅行的诱人邀请。

sentences.en: Johnson thought he had the board of directors in the palm of his hand.
sentences.cn: 约翰逊以为自己完全掌控了董事会。

sentences.en: most sellers are &B{palmed off with} a fraction of what something is worth.
sentences.cn: 大多数店主被骗接受了不及货物价值零头的价格。

sentences.en: Mr Johnson obviously know the street like the palm of his hand.
sentences.cn: 显然约翰逊先生非常熟悉这条街.

sentences.en: Palm Springs has ritzy restaurants and glitzy nightlife.
sentences.cn: 棕榈泉有高档的餐厅和奢华的夜生活。

sentences.en: Palm trees stir in the soft Pacific breeze.
sentences.cn: 棕榈树在太平洋和煦的微风中轻轻地摇动。

sentences.en: she had the audience in the palm of her hand.
She placed her hands palm uppermost in her lap.
sentences.cn: 她把手掌心向上放在大腿上。

sentences.en: The coconut palm is a native of Malaysia.
sentences.cn: 椰子树原产于马来西亚。

sentences.en: The palm of one's hand is slightly concave.
they &B{palmed off} their shoddiest products on the Russians.
sentences.cn: 他们骗卖给俄国人许多质量最差的产品。

sentences.en: Work the dough with the palm of your hand until it is very smooth.
sentences.cn: 用手掌将面团揉至光滑为止。

words.tran_cn: 手掌状的，[生物] 掌状的

phrases.tran_cn: n. 金棕榈奖（戛纳电影节的奖项之一）

phrases.phrase: have (或 hold) someone in the palm of one's hand
phrases.tran_cn: 把某人置于完全控制之下
棕榈滩（位于美国佛罗里达州东南部）
用欺骗的手段转让或卖掉
(非正式)用欺骗手段使别人接受某物
骗卖；用欺骗手段摆脱掉
[宗]圣枝主日（即复活节前的星期日）
西棕榈滩（美国度假胜地）

trans.tran_cn: 手掌，手心，棕榈树 ，由Palm公司发明的一种PDA上的操作系统
trans.tran_en: the inside surface of your hand, in which you hold things
